intro: Ervatamia, commonly known as the "dwarf ironweed," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs with narrow, gray-green leaves and small, blue or purple flowers. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Ervatamia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
